questions.text: Which of the following is a unit of conductance?
Apparent power in an AC circuit is the:

choices.text: Power stored in the reactive components.
Vector sum of active and reactive power.
The algebraic sum of active and reactive power.

questions.text: Avalanche breakdown in a PN junction diode occurs when:

choices.text: The forward voltage is too high.
Charge carriers gain enough kinetic energy to create new electron-hole pairs through collision.

questions.text: The region of operation for a BJT to be used as an amplifier is the:
A Schmitt trigger is a comparator circuit with hysteresis, used to:

choices.text: Convert a noisy or slowly changing input into a clean, stable digital output.

questions.text: A common-collector BJT amplifier, also known as an emitter follower, has a:

choices.text: High voltage gain and low current gain.
High voltage gain and high current gain.
Low voltage gain (approx. 1) and high current gain.
Low voltage gain and low current gain.

questions.text: The 1's complement of a binary number is obtained by:

choices.text: Inverting all the bits (0s become 1s and 1s become 0s).
Adding 1 to the least significant bit.
Shifting all bits to the left.

questions.text: Which of the following is a universal logic gate?
The 'preset' and 'clear' inputs on a flip-flop are asynchronous inputs, meaning they:

choices.text: Are effective only on a clock edge.
Affect the flip-flop's state regardless of the clock signal.
Are used to toggle the output.

questions.text: The 'word size' of a CPU refers to the:

choices.text: Number of instructions it can execute.
Number of bits the CPU can process in a single operation (e.g., size of its internal registers).

questions.text: Polling is a method of handling I/O where the CPU:

choices.text: Waits for an interrupt signal from the device.
Repeatedly checks the status of the device to see if it is ready.
Allows the device to directly access memory.

questions.text: In C, if you pass an array to a function, what is actually passed?

choices.text: A copy of the entire array.
A pointer to the first element of the array.
The number of elements in the array.
A copy of the last element.

questions.text: In C++, a 'static' member variable of a class is a variable that:

choices.text: Is created for each object of the class.
Is shared by all objects of the class.

questions.text: What is the function of an 'iterator' in the C++ STL?

choices.text: To provide a way to access the elements of a container sequentially.

questions.text: A 'superscalar' processor is one that can:

choices.text: Execute more than one instruction during a single clock cycle by using multiple execution units.

questions.text: 'Locality of reference' has two forms: temporal locality and spatial locality. Spatial locality refers to the tendency of a program to:

choices.text: Access the same memory location repeatedly.
Access memory locations that are close to each other.
Access memory in a random pattern.

questions.text: A 'mutex' (mutual exclusion) is a synchronization primitive that is primarily used to:

choices.text: Allow multiple threads to access a critical section simultaneously.
Protect a shared resource by allowing only one thread to access it at a time.
Signal other threads about an event.
Suspend a thread for a specific period.

questions.text: The TCP protocol establishes a connection using a process known as the:
An Autonomous System (AS) in the context of internet routing is a:

choices.text: A network of computers within a single organization.
A collection of connected IP routing prefixes under the control of a single administrative entity.
A protocol for assigning IP addresses.

questions.text: 'Phishing' is a type of security attack where the attacker:

choices.text: Tries to trick users into revealing sensitive information by masquerading as a trustworthy entity.
Installs ransomware on a user's computer.

questions.text: What is a 'context-free grammar' (CFG)?

choices.text: A formal grammar in which every production rule is of the form A → α, where A is a single non-terminal and α is a string of terminals and/or non-terminals.
A grammar that can be recognized by a finite automaton.
A grammar with no production rules.
A grammar that is not ambiguous.

questions.text: What does the 'R' in 'Turing' machine stand for?

choices.text: It does not stand for anything; it is named after Alan Turing.

questions.text: The Z-buffer algorithm is used in 3D computer graphics for:
In the graphics pipeline, what is 'rasterization'?

choices.text: The process of converting a vector image into a raster image (pixels) for display.
The process of transforming an object's vertices.
The process of lighting a scene.

questions.text: A 'binary tree' is a tree data structure in which each node has at most:
Which of the following sorting algorithms is considered 'in-place'?
What is the purpose of the COMMIT statement in SQL?

choices.text: To save all the changes made during the current transaction, making them permanent.
To delete data from a table.

questions.text: Short-term scheduler (or CPU scheduler) in an operating system selects a process from the:

choices.text: Job queue and loads it into memory.
Ready queue to be executed by the CPU.

questions.text: What is 'regression'?

choices.text: The re-emergence of a bug that was previously fixed.
A stage in the software development lifecycle.

questions.text: An 'activity diagram' in UML is used to model:

choices.text: The static structure of the system.
The flow of control or data between activities.

questions.text: The 'Factory Method' design pattern is a creational pattern that:

choices.text: Ensures a class only has one instance.
Provides an interface for creating objects in a superclass, but allows subclasses to alter the type of objects that will be created.
Attaches additional responsibilities to an object dynamically.
Defines a one-to-many dependency between objects.

questions.text: In a 'distributed system' architecture:

choices.text: All components run on a single machine.
Components are located on different networked computers and communicate by passing messages.
The system is easy to secure.

questions.text: In the context of problem-solving, a problem is 'well-defined' if it specifies the:

choices.text: Initial state, operators, goal test, and path cost.

questions.text: What is a 'chatbot'?

choices.text: A computer program designed to simulate conversation with human users, especially over the Internet.
A neural network for image recognition.

questions.text: The 'vanishing gradient problem' in deep neural networks is a difficulty found during training where:

choices.text: The gradients of the loss function become too large.
The gradients of the loss function approach zero, making it difficult to update the weights.
The network overfits the training data.
The network has too many layers.

questions.text: The 'straight-line method' is a method for calculating:
A 'stakeholder analysis' is performed in a project to:

choices.text: Identify all individuals and organizations impacted by the project and manage their expectations.
Choose the technology for the project.

questions.text: A 'change control board' (CCB) is a formal group of people responsible for:

choices.text: Reviewing, evaluating, and approving changes to the project.

questions.text: Which of the following actions is a violation of an engineer's ethical duty to the public?

choices.text: Performing services only in areas of their competence.
Approving engineering documents that are not in conformity with applicable standards.
Striving to increase the competence of the engineering profession.
Acting for their client as a faithful agent.

questions.text: The Nepal Engineering Council Registration Examination is designed to:

choices.text: Ensure that a graduate engineer has the minimum level of knowledge required to practice the profession safely and ethically.
Provide a scholarship for further studies.
Serve as a substitute for a university degree.

questions.text: In a series RLC circuit, at resonance, the impedance is:

choices.text: Minimum and equal to the resistance (R).

questions.text: An N-channel MOSFET requires a ____ gate-to-source voltage to turn on.
A 'register' is a type of:
What is 'swapping' in an operating system?

choices.text: The process of moving a process from main memory to secondary storage (and vice versa).
The process of switching the CPU between processes.

questions.text: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for framing?
A 'compiler' translates source code into:
A 'priority queue' is an abstract data type where each element has a 'priority' and:

choices.text: Elements are served on a FIFO basis.
Elements are served on a LIFO basis.
An element with high priority is served before an element with low priority.
Elements are served in random order.

questions.text: What does the 'RAII' (Resource Acquisition Is Initialization) principle in C++ entail?

choices.text: A design idiom where resource management (like memory or file handles) is tied to the lifetime of objects.
The process of acquiring resources from the operating system.

questions.text: In machine learning, 'recall' (also known as sensitivity) is a metric that measures:

choices.text: The ability of a model to find all the relevant cases within a dataset.
The overall accuracy of the model.
The proportion of negative cases that were correctly identified.

questions.text: What is a 'project baseline'?

choices.text: The initial approved plan for the project (scope, schedule, and cost), used as a benchmark for measuring performance.
The final report of the project.

questions.text: The power factor of a circuit can be improved by connecting a ____ in parallel with the load.
A 'static hazard' in a digital logic circuit is a transient glitch that occurs when:

choices.text: A single input variable change should not cause the output to change, but it does momentarily.
The clock signal is too slow.
The circuit enters an invalid state.

questions.text: In C, the sizeof operator returns the size of a variable or data type in:
What is a 'monitor' in the context of concurrent programming?

choices.text: A synchronization construct that provides mutual exclusion and the ability for threads to wait on certain conditions.
A tool for tracking system performance.

questions.text: The maximum length of an Ethernet frame is typically:
A problem is in the complexity class 'P' if:

choices.text: It can be solved by a deterministic Turing machine in polynomial time.
It can be verified by a deterministic Turing machine in polynomial time.
It requires exponential time to solve.

questions.text: 'Continuous Integration' (CI) is a software development practice where:

choices.text: Developers integrate code into a shared repository several times a day.
The software is released to customers continuously.
The integration testing is done only at the end of the project.
The software is developed by a single person.

questions.text: In AI, a 'constraint satisfaction problem' is a problem that is solved by:

choices.text: Finding a state that satisfies a given set of constraints.
Finding the shortest path to a goal.
Playing a game against an opponent.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of an 'internal stakeholder' in a project?

choices.text: A member of the project team

questions.text: The slew rate of an op-amp is the:

choices.text: Maximum rate of change of its output voltage.
Ratio of output to input voltage.
Range of frequencies it can amplify.

questions.text: A current of 5A flows through a 2H inductor. What is the energy stored in the inductor? ($E = 0.5 \times L \times I^2$)
What is the decimal equivalent of the 4-bit 2's complement number 1011?

choices.text: It checks if n is an even number.
It checks if n is a power of 2.
It checks if n is an odd number.
It calculates the number of set bits in n.

questions.text: A 4-way set-associative cache has a total of 128 lines. How many sets does the cache have?

A router using a distance-vector protocol receives an update from its neighbor B, which claims it can reach network X with a cost of 3. If the cost for the router to reach neighbor B is 2, what will be the router's new cost to reach network X via B?
A polygon has vertices (1,1), (5,1), and (3,4). What are the coordinates of the vertex (3,4) after translating the polygon by a vector (2, -3)?
For an unweighted, undirected graph, which algorithm is best suited for finding the shortest path (in terms of number of edges) between two nodes?

A system uses a Least Recently Used (LRU) page replacement policy. Given the page reference string 1, 2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 4 page frames, which page will be replaced when page 5 is referenced for the second time?
A project has a Net Present Value (NPV) of Rs. 50,000 and an Internal Rate of Return (IRR) of 15%. If the Minimum Acceptable Rate of Return (MARR) is 12%, should the project be accepted?

choices.text: Yes, because NPV > 0 and IRR > MARR.
No, because the IRR is too low.
No, because the NPV should be higher.
Cannot be determined from the given information.

questions.text:
What is the result of the following SQL query on a table Employees?
SELECT Name FROM Employees ORDER BY Salary DESC, Name ASC;

choices.text: All employee names, sorted by salary in ascending order.
All employee names, sorted first by salary in descending order, and then alphabetically for employees with the same salary.

questions.text: What is the fundamental difference between 'verification' and 'validation' in software quality assurance?

choices.text: Verification is 'building the product right'; Validation is 'building the right product'.
Validation is 'building the product right'; Verification is 'building the right product'.
Verification is done by the customer; Validation is done by the developer.

questions.text: A 24-bit color display uses 8 bits for each of the Red, Green, and Blue components. How many different colors can it represent?
In the OSI model, if a packet travels from Host A to Host B through two routers (R1 and R2), how many times is the Data Link Layer header processed?
What type of language is generated by the grammar $S \rightarrow a S b \mid ab$?
A dataset for classifying fruits has two features: weight (in grams) and color (red=0, yellow=1). Which feature would a decision tree algorithm likely split on first if it uses Information Gain?

choices.text: It will always split on weight.
It will always split on color.
It will split on the feature that results in the greatest reduction in uncertainty (highest information gain).

questions.text: A system's memory consists of partitions of sizes 100K, 500K, 200K, 300K, and 600K. A new process requires 212K of memory. Which partition would be allocated using the 'Best Fit' algorithm?
Which design pattern would be most suitable for an application that needs to support different database backends (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite) without changing the main application logic?
A 3-to-8 decoder with an active-low enable input will output all HIGHs when:

choices.text: Any of the address inputs are HIGH.
All of the address inputs are LOW.

questions.text: In a PERT chart, if an activity has an optimistic time of 3, a pessimistic time of 9, and a most likely time of 6, what is its expected duration?
